info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 3:39PM CDT until June 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Cowleech Fork Sabine River At Greenville affecting Hunt County.
South Fork Sabine River Near Quinlan affecting Rockwall and Hunt Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Cowleech Fork Sabine River at Greenville.
* WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Moderate out of bank flooding will occur. A few rural roads closures will be needed along the river reach. Moderate flooding will occur along the river through Greenville.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall early tomorrow afternoon. It will rise to 16.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning.
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.water.noaa.gov/wfo/FWD.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING
